    • Method Detail

      • loadDbDriver

        public Class<?> loadDbDriver()
        This method should be called once to load the database driver.
        A SqlPool will call this method when the pool is opened.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if loading the driver failed.

      • create

        public Connection create()
        Creates a connection. This method is called synchronized from DbPool (i.e. no need to synchronize anything further).
        Specified by:
        create in interface IPoolFactory<Connection>
        Returns:
        The created resource, never null.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(Connection c)
        Description copied from interface: IPoolFactory
        Ensures a resource is still valid.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        true if resource if valid, false if resource is invaliad

      • setLowSocketTimeOut

        protected void setLowSocketTimeOut(Connection c)
        When rolling back and closing a database connection, make sure this does not hang on a connection issue. If "setSocketTimeout(int)" method exists, set it to 1000 milliseconds.
